___serverFilesCourse.description: The list of files or directories that will be copied from course/externalGradingFiles/ to /grade/shared/

items.description: A single file or directory that will be copied to the external grader.

___timeout.description: The number of seconds after which the grading job will timeout.

___enabled.description: Whether the external grader is currently enabled. Useful if it is breaking, for example.

___image.description: The Docker image that will be used to grade this question. Should be specified as Dockerhub image.

___enableNetworking.description: Whether the grading containers should have network access. Access is disabled by default.

___entrypoint.description: Program to run as the entrypoint to your grader. Must be runnable as 'chmod +x script && ./script'.

___options.description: Options that define how the question will work, specific to the individual question type.

___tags.description: Extra tags associated with the question (e.g., 'Exam Only', 'Broken').

items.description: A tag associated with a question.

___template.description: The QID of a question that serves at the template for this question.

___clientTemplates.description: List of client-accessible templates to render server-side.

items.description: A single template file accessible by the client.

___title.description: The title of the question (e.g., 'Addition of vectors in Cartesian coordinates').

___secondaryTopics.description: Other topics also covered by the question (e.g., 'Vectors', 'Energy').

items.description: A single topic covered by the question.

___singleVariant.description: Whether the question is not randomized and only generates a single variant (defaults to "false").

___gradingMethod.description: The grading method used for this question.

___partialCredit.description: Whether the question will give partial points for fractional scores (defaults to "false" for v2 questions and "true" for v3.).

___clientFiles.description: The list of question files accessible by the client (defaults to ["client.js"]).

items.description: A single file accessible by the client.
